nodes.bodyText:
I think generated sql from orElse(null) will be IS 'null'. My initial local implementation was like this. What do you think about it?
        String sql = format(
                "COMMENT ON COLUMN %s.%s IS %s",
                quoted(handle.getRemoteTableName()),
                quoted(column.getColumnName()),
                comment.isPresent() ? format("'%s'", comment.get()) : "NULL");

we should not add a four-letter comment (with letters n, u, l, l) unless user explicitly requested that
you can think of that String.valueOf(null) returns "null" (and not something else)  is Presto's impl details and should not affected user visible behavior.

PostgreSQL doesn't store empty comment

Then maybe we should not allow users to set empty comments. Displaying nulls when empty string was set could be misleading.

PostgreSQL doesn't store empty comment

Then maybe we should not allow users to set empty comments. Displaying nulls when empty string was set could be misleading.

arguably this ship has sailed -- we've deliberately followed this path in case of other connectors before.

arguably this ship has sailed -- we've deliberately followed this path in case of other connectors before.

What postgres do when user do COMMENT ON COLUMN tpch.test_column_comment.col2 IS null?
If it fails we should fail as well. I don't want to comment other connector behaviour.

PostgreSQL removes a comment in case of IS NULL.
tpch=# \d+ tpch.test;
                          Table "tpch.test"
 Column |  Type   | Modifiers | Storage | Stats target | Description
--------+---------+-----------+---------+--------------+-------------
 c1     | integer |           | plain   |              | foo

tpch=#
tpch=# comment on column tpch.test.c1 is null;
COMMENT
tpch=#
tpch=# \d+ tpch.test;
                          Table "tpch.test"
 Column |  Type   | Modifiers | Storage | Stats target | Description
--------+---------+-----------+---------+--------------+-------------
 c1     | integer |           | plain   |              |
https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-comment.html

To remove a comment, write NULL in place of the text string

What does it mean remove a comment? Insert null?
What about
SELECT d.description IS NULL FROM pg_description d, pg_class c WHERE  d.oid = c.oid AND c.relname = 'test'

?

Yes, it inserts null.
tpch=# \pset null (null)
Null display is "(null)".
tpch=#
tpch=# comment on column tpch.test.c1 is 'foo';
COMMENT
tpch=#
tpch=# select c.column_name, c.data_type, pgd.description, pgd.description is null
tpch-# from pg_catalog.pg_statio_all_tables as st
tpch-# inner join pg_catalog.pg_description pgd on (pgd.objoid=st.relid)
tpch-# right outer join information_schema.columns c on (pgd.objsubid=c.ordinal_position and  c.table_schema=st.schemaname and c.table_name=st.relname)
tpch-# where table_schema = 'tpch' and table_name = 'test';
 column_name | data_type | description | ?column?
-------------+-----------+-------------+----------
 c1          | integer   | foo         | f
(1 row)

tpch=#
tpch=# comment on column tpch.test.c1 is null;
COMMENT
tpch=#
tpch=# select c.column_name, c.data_type, pgd.description, pgd.description is null
tpch-# from pg_catalog.pg_statio_all_tables as st
tpch-# inner join pg_catalog.pg_description pgd on (pgd.objoid=st.relid)
tpch-# right outer join information_schema.columns c on (pgd.objsubid=c.ordinal_position and  c.table_schema=st.schemaname and c.table_name=st.relname)
tpch-# where table_schema = 'tpch' and table_name = 'test';
 column_name | data_type | description | ?column?
-------------+-----------+-------------+----------
 c1          | integer   | (null)      | t
(Changed query because it didn't return anything)
it'd be better to generate explicit COMMENT ... IS NULL when comment.isEmpty()
Can you please define issues to cover other JDBC connectors?
